csg/share/scripts/inverse/configuration_compare.py

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #!/usr/bin/env python2

00019 #option parsing
00020 #TODO optparse is depreceated since 2.7
00021 #switch to argparse (NOT supported in 2.6)
00022 
00023 from optparse import OptionParser
00024 
00025 usage = "usage: %prog [options] conf1 conf2"
00026 parser = OptionParser(usage=usage)
00027 parser.add_option("--eps", dest="eps", metavar="EPS",
00028                   help="tolerance for mismatch", default=1e-2)
00029 (options, args) = parser.parse_args()                  
00030 
00031 def die(str):
00032   print str
00033   quit(254)
00034 
00035 if len(args) != 2:
00036   die("two configurations required as parameters")
00037 
00038 #open both files
00039 try: 
00040   conf1 = open(args[0])
00041   conf2 = open(args[1])
00042 except:
00043   die("error while opening files")
00044 
00045 #skip the first line
00046 conf1.readline()
00047 conf2.readline()
00048 
00049 #compare the second line (nat)
00050 if str(conf1.readline()).strip() != str(conf2.readline()).strip():
00051   die("nat does not match")
00052 
00053 conf1 = conf1.readlines()
00054 conf2 = conf2.readlines()
00055 #loop through files
00056 for i in range(len(conf1)):
00057   vals1 = conf1[i].split()
00058   vals2 = conf2[i].split()
00059   #6 cols expected
00060   if len(vals1) != 6: break
00061   #compare 1st, 2nd, 3rd column without tolerance
00062   for j in range(3):
00063     if vals1[j] != vals2[j]: 
00064       die("mismatch in line "+str(i+3)+" col "+str(j+1)+", "+str(vals1[j])+"!="+str(vals2[j]))
00065 
00066   #compare 4th-6th col with tolerance
00067   for j in range(3,6):
00068     if abs(float(vals1[j]) - float(vals2[j])) > options.eps: 
00069       die("mismatch in line "+str(i+3)+" col "+str(j+1)+", "+str(vals1[j])+"!="+str(vals2[j]))
00070 
00071 #compare last line without tolerance
00072 for j in range(3):
00073   if vals1[j] != vals2[j]: 
00074     die("mismatch in line "+str(i+3)+" col "+str(j+1)+", "+str(vals1[j])+"!="+str(vals2[j]))
